summary: Servicemembers (like most Americans) enter into contracts with mandatory arbitration clauses—such as apartment leases. These contracts require disputes to be resolved in private proceedings with arbitrators instead of in court. Congress mandated that GAO study the effects of these clauses on specific employment and consumer protections afforded to servicemembers. Officials from four federal agencies reported that these clauses have generally not prevented them from investigating...
title: Servicemember Rights: Mandatory Arbitration Clauses Have Affected Some Employment and Consumer Claims but the Extent of Their Effects is Unknown
